title: Types and Traits

version_changes.summary: Union types now used in FFI layer, raw pointer usage increased for expanded FFI, new StaticVec/StaticString types
key_changes: Union types introduced (0 -> 42) for C FFI bindings
*mut pointer usage increased significantly for FFI
New StaticVec<T, N> and StaticString<N> types replace FixedSize* types

summary: FLS Chapter 4 defines types and traits. Types define sets of values and operations. This mapping covers all type categories as defined in the FLS and their usage in iceoryx2.

findings.description: Boolean type used extensively for flags, conditions, and state tracking.
Char type is minimally used - byte types (u8) preferred for ASCII operations.
findings.rationale: IPC data uses byte arrays; char is Unicode which adds complexity

samples_waiver.explanation: Pattern found in limited locations (2 unique files) despite 3 total matches

findings.description: Integer types are extensively used with explicit sizing for safety-critical code.
Floating point types minimally used for safety-critical determinism.
All integer types used with explicit sizing.
findings.note: usize most common for indexing and sizes

samples_waiver.explanation: This section describes an abstract concept not directly mappable to concrete code patterns
This section describes an abstract concept not directly mappable to concrete code patterns

findings.description: Fixed-size arrays used for buffers, initialization, and const-generic containers.
Slice types (&[T]) used extensively for dynamic views into arrays and vectors.
String slices (&str) used for string literals and borrowed string data.
Tuple types used for multiple return values and pattern matching.

samples_waiver.explanation: This section describes an abstract concept not directly mappable to concrete code patterns

findings.description: Enums extensively used for error types, state machines, and options.
findings.repr_c_enums: FFI enums use #[repr(C)] for C compatibility

findings.description: Structs are the primary data structure type.
NEW in v0.8.0 - Unions used exclusively for FFI C API discriminated unions.
findings.pattern: ManuallyDrop<T> wraps variants for explicit lifetime control

findings.description: Closures used for callbacks, iterators, and functional patterns.
Function items are zero-sized types representing specific functions.

findings.description: Function pointers used for FFI callbacks and dynamic dispatch.
Raw pointers (*const T, *mut T) heavily used for FFI and shared memory.
findings.mut_ptr: *mut T for mutable FFI data and shared memory
findings.note: +2000 from v0.7.0 due to FFI expansion

findings.description: References are the primary safe pointer type.

findings.description: impl Trait minimally used - explicit types preferred for clarity.
dyn Trait used for dynamic dispatch when needed.

Uninhabited types (empty enums) are not used in iceoryx2.

union_types.change: NEW - union types for FFI layer

safety_patterns.marker_traits: unsafe impl Send/Sync with careful review (43 total)
safety_patterns.interior_mutability: UnsafeCell usage in lock-free structures (231 uses)
safety_patterns.lifetime_bounds: Explicit lifetime relationships for borrow safety

type_safety_features.explicit_typing: Minimal type inference - explicit annotations preferred
type_safety_features.trait_bounds: Send + Sync + Copy + Debug common bounds
type_safety_features.new_container_types: StaticVec and StaticString with const generics for no_std support
